y 3, 2014
												First off, I have been playing the X series since day one, so my judgement is naturally influenced by what i have seen before and what improvements i would have expected to see now. I have played 40+ hours on this one. So here goes my first impressions:PRO:The universe is beautiful. Actually perfect. Best I have seen in space games so far and probably exactly how I would have done it with the technical means of today. Full of life. I love exploring it and this is a big part of X. I don't mind the fact that you can only fly one ship as long as you can do a lot of upgrades with it and at some point feel like a boss. I have the feeling it's a bit to easy to get there though (which is a pro for some ppl who would just like to explore). I like that they moved to controller support but more on that in the CONS. And last but not least X Rebirth supports Mods, which are very easy to install/deinstall via Nexus Mod Manager.CONS:Game breaking bugs everywhere. Which has been covered to a huge extend in many forums, so I will not go into details, but as I was playing in the beginning I didn't notice them at all. Only later when you have to manage your first trade freighters you will realize the problems with Bugs, the UI or just the plain misunderstanding of how things work. The main story serves more like a tutorial than an actual story and does a very bad job at that. Most important things that one need to know are not explained properly by your co-pilot. The voice acting btw is horrible. Very often I thought I witnessed another bug and later found out it was a misunderstood feature. It's funny how many of the new features made a nice impression at first, but then you get annoyed by them. Here are some examples...You can walk around stations, but sooner or later you will switch that feature off via mods, because the stations are so sterile and boring. The characters are animated poorly and the "smalltalk" minigame gets so much on my nerves, that i prefer to pay the normal price instead of going through it for a discount.You can travel via highways, which is a brilliant idea to not cut immersion when going from one sector/system to the next, but you will switch off the lame lane mini-game via a mod pretty soon, i promise you that!The controller support is nice to lean back and control everything on a big screen from the couch, but the UI is a torture. On one screen you have to press A to confirm, on the following screen you have to press X to confirm. The radial menu is very unresponsive to navigate through it fast enough to be comfortable and many of the details on your ships for example you have to reach not by the normal axis you use for the radial menu but with your digital cross. a few filters you can only select with the mouse and very common tasks are hidden way deep in some sub-sub-sub-menu. X was always known for horrible UI but they improved it with every iteration of the series. Now with the controller support it feels like we are back at day 1.You cannot rename your ships, nor is all their status broadcast to you. If one of your ships gets attacked, you would like to rush over there to help them out, right? Bad luck, because the captain will tell you that he is about to unload freight, but not that they are under attack. In fact, you will only realize when you want to give a new trade order and find out that your freighter does not exist anymore. Thats one of those moments, where I assumed it was a bug.You know those indicators, pointing to objects that are outside of your vision? Yeah, you don't have a radar (which is fine by me) but those triangles and circles on the borders of your screen. Wait a second, they are at the border of your window of the ship, so you have to scan with your eyes an uneven area around the window for your enemies red triangles, which by the way are sometimes hidden behind the cockpit metal thingy. Although I like the cockpit, it just blocks too much space. I like the fact that you can switch it off, but then you also switch of all the holographic displays and menus.I would have prefered to see a three-degree-switch: cockpit on, holographic only, off.Also I would have prefered to have items that are outside of my vision to be indicated around my crosshair and not at the edges of the cockpit window. Or at least at the edges of my screen, because then i would have a clear idea about where to look for my enemy in a dogfight.CONCLUSION:I am sure that I would find more annoyances if I would continue thinking about them long enough. But I won't. All in all I really see the potential of this game becoming great and I am quite impressed what a game studio with only around 20 people is able to produce. But unfortunately this one is just a beta quality at best. I have no clue why it got released in this state. And I really hope it's not going to be the end of Egosoft, but I think it very well could be. However, they always released games with bugs and were able to fix them. It was just never that bad as far as I remember it.All in all, I would really like to recommend the game, especially because of its atmosphere, but without mods and savegame editing its nearly unplayable beyond the first 10h. I am sure they are going to fix that though, so just wait a while and watch the forums for messages talking about how it improved... i hope sooner than later!

y 10, 2014
												I need to admit it: X rebirth is fun to play.I am buyer of the first hour and know the frustration about lagging, bugs, story issues etc.Now, with version 1.22, the game is still not "ready", but I really enjoy playing it.You need to be willing to spend some time learning the game. But the first time you send your marines and enter an enemy freighter, just to capture it and use the goods for your new built station, you really have this "Wow"-effect that you dont often see in games. From that point onwards, it becomes an motivating sandbox-scifi-simulation worth playing.Yes, it still has its problems: low framerate with shadows on, ugly characters, some minor story issues, way too complex trading and building text menus, way too easy dogfights and a freighter AI that reminds me strongly about the collectors of the first C&C game. And not to forget the boring travelling on the highways, where you can do almost nothing for minutes.But if you give it time and have the patience to learn how to play it, you can have tons of fun with it.I played it now for many hours but still are highly motivated. Summing up: yes, this is really a nice Pre-Alpha game that I would recommend (assuming that Egosoft continues to build patches and improve above mentioned issues).

No.Will this game get better, and justify the faith shown by those who have played the game? Most certainly.Despite the critical gaming reviews out there, I have still come back and played through the game. I've not completed it by any means, but I am enjoying my journey so far.

												So. I own the entire X-Series minus rebirth, and I tried this on the free weekend. I want to preface saying I want this game to be good so badly. I really enjoy space and flight sims, and I fly with joystick, throttle, track-ir, rudder pedals. These two points make this game, unfortuantely not even worth the sale $13 IMO.First off, there is no Track-IR or head tracking support. Alone that wouldn't be a deal breaker but it adds a lot to games like this and it's a very serious consideration when I purchase a game.Second, this game only supports one device at a time, meaning I can only use my joystick, my throttle, OR my rudder pedals. This is absolutely a complete turn-off for this game and is the primary reason I decided I didn't even want to play it for free.It's with deep sadness to say that this game is absolutely not designed with flight simmers even in mind. I hate to turn away from a game series I have enjoyed so much in the past, but this just does not have even the most basic features standard to the genre.

												Hello there!So lets start by saying, Sure the launch of this game have been a bit rough. And the forums been littered with both "trolls" and unresonable and sometimes even childish flaming anger. So it is hard to see the good in it. I can understand some of the rage of course - i think it safe to say we all did not expect it to get this shaky launch client. But in the first week they pretty much daily released patches fixing most of the smaller bugs. And the game is really beautiful and very much alive. When they patch it up a little bit more in the next few days and weeks - i truly believe this game to have great potential being both the best (space/simulator game) this year. I have just about 90 hours logged into this game here on steam. And realistically maybe 40-60 active game hours. And ive enjoyed it a lot despite the low framerate! :). Capturing ships and managed to build a few stations, it is just really cool. Currently as im writing this there is a preformance issue - especially on high end systems. (mine = FX8350 - GTX 770 - 12GB RAM) Where you get an average fps around 22. Jumping from 12-28 or 29 - 70 depending on where you are in the game - or rather the zone population, both NPC and graphics alike . And secondly a major bug they are having at the moment have broken down the trading system quite a bit - npc traders - yours or the NPC Factions - are standing still without sending the goods upon trying to trade.However - they will fix this in a matter of few days - latest words (2013-11-28) Developers said they should have a major fix that they have been working on all week, to be hopefully be released before the weekend, tomorrow friday or saturday.For me personally this bug only seems to be occuring in highly populated sectors - in some cases it still works. In either case - these issues are soon a thing of the past. You can check out what they are working on here: http://forum.egosoft.com/viewtopic.php?t=352790 - If you want to buy this - you really want to read this, a roadmap they have to fix things. With that said - They are working hard on fixing stuff - and they have a long history of long continous support of their games. So I have by no doubt any regrets in saying that i highly reccomend you to this game. Just expect it to a bit uneaven the next few weeks. If you dont mind a few bugs, that soon will be fixed - or having irregular FPS - go ahead and get it now! There is a lot to do in this game outside of the trading :). Besides, this is a space simulator - you do not NEED constand 60 fps here - this is not a multiplayer game. around 30 fps is well enough to enjoy it (30fps temporaly until they fix the engine) However if you still do like to buy this but feel a bit unsure of it - If you dont think you can enjoy the game "lagging" - Id say you should either buy it and wait or just wait to buy it until they fixes these issues.Fly safe!

er 25, 2013
												To start, I've player the game before this one all the way to Albion Prelude and I have always loved X3 and I was looking forward to this one and my review is simple, It's different.  They changed a few things to accommodate the new interface for Rebirth which is of course centered around two promises the developers made to the fans of the series, ship and station interiors.  To their credit they deliver in their promise however I think what they gave us was lacking it even looked a bit rush with the character model designs and the limitation of being stuck in a single ship because they didn't make interiors for every ship isn't something I can simply ignore.  However as far as criticism goes that is the only thing I can say that Rebirth falls short in, the changes they have made to accommodate the new method of interacting with the universe in particular trade and mining are merely different but not wrong in my opinion and as for the limited interior designs are in the stations my complant is only that they could of added more variety then just one design per station interior type and maybe add a map to help with orienting players to the area but on to the plus sides.For one thing the time Rebirth takes place in in relation to the games that came before it have changed the way you navigate around the universe, they have basically removed loading times when traveling through space, gates are gone and replaced with "highways" where you basically drift through a current of energy (or something like that) which you can control to a point following traffic in the highway which allows you to travel faster on the highway and getting off the highway whenever you choose to.  The X universe looks more lively in Rebirth then the games before it as you can watch lines of ships going to their intended destination and it gives a sense of structured traffic and life in the outposts, the graphics are very good and the detail is pretty good, not great or mind blowing but it's clear they put work into it and it shows, for the most part the freedom of the X games is intact if a little changed.All and all Rebirth has it's problems but they are not enough to ruin the game as a whole and the changes that have been made you can get use to so I would recommend this game if your an X fan (just be sure to be prepared for some disappointments) and if you've never played an X game before but are interested with the premises I would honestly say you might be unimpressed considering it's price so I would recommend trying the one that came before it and if you like that one save up for Rebirth because it is a good game just not something you should risk $50 on if your not sure about liking what you see and read.

												At launch this game has suffered a lot of game breaking bugs making it nearly impossible for most players to get into. At the moment, wait for patches and mods to come and fix it. With that said however this game has the potential to be the best X game yet.Much more user friendly, you'll find yourself fighting and flying in no time with little issue.Some gripes I have personally however are minor but still notable. Such as the lack of the SETA drive. For those unfamiliar the SETA drive allowed the player to speed up time by a factor of up to 10 times making tedious missions less of a chore. This feature could save the player up to 1 hour of travel time in the span of 10-20 minutes depending on the ship he or she is piloting.Another issue is with how Egosoft forces players to leave their ship in order to talk to and deal with NPC's. This makes a task that would normally only take a few seconds much more time consuming and can often cause frame drops. My guess is Egosoft has little experience with interiors and have yet to optimize this properly.And the biggest gripe I have is the inability to pilot other ships. Now I knew this going in so I can't blame anyone for misinformation. However it is unforunate. The very least they could have done in my opinion would be to allow the player to remain docked on a larger vessel and take command of that vessel. But instead you need to hire a pilot for every ship and a crew to accommodate that ship. Without a crew you're likely to find your ship destroyed in no time. On the bright side however, hiring an Engineer for your large ship allows you to use him or her to repair your personal ship as well as the ship they are assigned to.All in all this is a wonderful game. It's just right now it's very difficult to get far in the game without experiencing a bug that either crashes the game or makes a mission impossible to beat.Wait until Egosoft fixes this game unless your a die hard X fan and understand that you are not buying a finished product.

												X-Rebirth or "How to blow your franchise reputation in one release"... Well, the game is full of bugs and crashes, under resolution. But what hurt is beneath. As almost unanimously reported, X fans still don't understand why the devs went so wrong and so far from the original soul of the game. People was therefore welcoming the change of the UI, to something a bit more fancy and open.But to that ! To summarize : - Great, a cockpit ! WHY Can't we see out of it !- Awesome ! Bars and stations to land on ! WHY only 3 models ? Why so few interaction ? Why stupidly looting the same space suits and entertainment consoles ?- Nice, lot of space craft traffick ! WHY just to queue and kill your frame rate ?- Smart, the highways ! WHERE are the crafts appearing and disappearing from on it ? - interesting, cockpit HUD - but where is the radar, the clear map, the command bindings ?- One ship to fly with ONLY ? Cannot buy & sell goods at one central place ? Market place looks like a dead stock market with 2 lost guys on it ?  - 5 weapons (including mining laser) ? 3 missiles types ? so few upgrades for your ship ! X Rebirth is the best example of the long awaited game that comes totally out of purpose. Like they didn't tested it, like there was no Beta to get the awful feedback of the players. And this even more cause everyone was so looking forward to it.Game updates will fix the crashes, but won't resolve the game lacks & faults. A huge rescript could, but I doubt the game will even allow it. That's a lost occasion to release THE space sim. Guess we can only hope now on the First (and probably best) one, Elite serie. Check out for Elite Dangerous, under dev and hopefully planned for 2014. Let's hope Egosoft will learn from their mistake, stop thinking they can release a popular space sim to be sold on next gen consoles and just do what they know to do. Deep, complex, highly customizable and rich space sim.Osiris

												X Rebirth has provided a few gaming firsts for me in this genre. First: Buying a ship and watching it being built from the railing of the shipyard. Second: Being docked on a ship and ordering the captain to take me where I want to go, all while watching some of the best space scenery pass by while standing in the hangar of said ship. Now, I've played a lot of games with space and space travel being the premise and never have I seen this kind of vision or ambition in a game. Of course, perhaps Egosoft was too ambitious. A lot of the systems that are implemented are prone to failure, some of them gamebreaking. But I've played X2: Beyond and X3:TC and AP, I can say that this company never stops working on their games, the FANS never stop working on their games. Most people who have played this game get down on it for being buggy. Try to picture it this way, all of you have played betas, bought into kickstarter games, etc. and these games will have their problems, I've got friends who have plunked down 200 clams on Star Citizen to simply get a hangar and explore their ship. My point being, don't jump on the bandwagon of bashing Egosoft simply because their game came out about the same time the Steam Review system did. Think about it for a minute. Any basement-virgin-internet-punk can bash a game. And destroy the english language in the process, but my respect goes to the articulate. Thanks to Steam, we can play this game any time after purchase, and thanks to Egosoft, this game will be perfect given enough time, I'm excited to see where it's at a year from now.

												  This game is hard one to judge to be honest. While it is a X series game and if your a fan of the series you are well aware that just about all the games have had a rocky start. However to Egosofts credit they have always done well by there fans by squashing bugs and adding features that the fans want. This game is no different as Ego has already stated that after optimizing the game they will begin to add the features that are needed and fixing others. I dont want to sound like a fan boy or anything but I admit I am a fan of the series and I do have faith that the game will be fixed up. Alot of people have given this game a negative review based solely on the fact that they spent full price on a game thats buggy and unfinished.....Well I say to those people welcome to the digital download world. They are not even close to first developers who have done this and we might as well get use to it because I dont see it changing anytime soon. Ego is a small company and they listen to there fans for the most part so give them a chance to fix and change it. Now on to the game. Graphics in space are gorgeous...stations are well done as well as the ships. However the inside of stations and the NPC's look like something out of a old halflife mod. The flying and dogfighting is fun however at the moment , joystick commands and the AI for the enemy ships needs tweeking. They have already stated that both of these things are top of there list of things to fix. Combat around a station is really annoying cause the AI get stuck and if you shoot and hit the station those people yell at you and well it needs alot of work. The text menu has been replaced with a conversation menu which is better but not yet finished if you ask me. Alot more commands are needed before its up to par...and again this is on the list to be fixed. The story in the campaign is good but the voice acting is mediocre and some of the slang in game needs taken out. All in all it surely has its problems but it also has great potential and im sure ego will show that as well as modders who will bring other great things as well...I could easily see star wars and Battlestar Galactica mods being made. I am going to recommend this game because EGo is a small developer not run by some corporate windbag publisher telling to work on dlc and the game fixes later....we have to support these type of developers.There has already been numerouse patches since release and another about to come out. I fully recommend this game but wether you should buy now at full price or wait till later is up to you obviously.

er 29, 2013
												Summary: - The game is an attempt at a reboot. So I'm judging the game as a new title instead of comparing it to previous games (which are better, and the next 2 years sees some even better games comming out).- Bad story though good gameplay like previous x games- buggy on launch like all x games are on launch though given time will be up to scratch- system requirements are wrong on store page the min requriements should be the recomended requirements.- The cause of many of the bad reviews are because this game attracted more people who don't usually play x games so were unexpecting the launch bugs while also don't understand "how to play" an x game. This combined with the incorrect system requirements on the store page is the root cause of the bad reviews.- The rest of the bad reviews are from the long term fans of the game. The game is lacking a large amount of the functionality from X2/X3 and has regressed to be more like the first game in the series and as a result you have less control and freedom in the game than the previous two titles.Although I'm judging the game as its own title, it needs to be said that the game is an attempt at a reboot. Egosoft were for a time not going to make any more "X" series games and were going to work on something else. Due to fan feedback they decided to make their next title an X game after all (I beleive they just slapped the X label on what they were working on, this timing would have been very early in development so wouldn't have caused them much issue). While as its own game, it is a nice little diversion while I wait for better games comming out over the next 2 years (primarily Star Citizen and Elite: Dangerous) the previous games (X3/X2) are better overall.This game is like all X games, they start out buggy though not unplayable and over time the bugs are quickly resolved. If you've played an X game before you will expect this. Be warned however there is alot more under the hood besides the graphics this time around meaning you need a beefy PC to run it. The system requirements on the store page are not accurate and were probably written early in the games development though noone has thought to recheck.The story is pretty terrible but lets face it, X games never have a good story. The game world is interesting and detailed, with lots of background history that is interesting. The gameplay isn't so different from previous X games though the interface is different in both good and bad ways meaning it is improved in some areas though worse in others evening out over all.

												Same old Song writen and performed by Egosoft. It´s like when you hear your favorite Band announces they are reinventing themself and you have been with them for Decades, X-Beyond was actually the first Game i bought my own Computer with my own Money. I suffered throught the early Stages of the Delivery and fell madly in Love with the Series since. Then came last Year, i totally lost it and went berserk over what Egosoft had done to my beloved Game. The Pure Idea of changing so many core Principles of the Game made me sick. Then i learned that I was not alone,  a Tsunami errupted like i have not seen in along Time in the Gaming Community. Everybody was going after X-Rebirth, spilling their contempt feelings of betrayl and some even accused Egosoft of scamming their loyal Fan Base. I was one of those People and I didn´t hold back on my Opinion and lashed out, and I want to appolozige for that !! The Thing is I started playing X-Rebirth after 2.0 Patch, granted only little amounts at a Time since my workloud has been crazy, but I have to confess I like it now.The Reasons for my change of Heart are that I come to realize that Egosoft didn´t change a thing in ways of the Core Principle, they just change the Visual Framwork, granted they didn´t perform a stellar Performance there, but when i look at somebody i don´t see the clothes of the Person i try to get the know the Person with all it´s Nuances and Shades. Thinking of it Egosoft actually enhanced the X Experience by integrating In Station Modules and NPC´s, ok they look and Sound like Crap but know it´s turning into a treasur hunt, finding the right Place to get and sell Wares use different kind of Methods of aquiring Wealth and Information. The X Series for me was never to own the biggest Ship or Station, blasting my enemies into Oblivion was never my thing, I was hooked on the Economy of the Game what happens when you introduce a new Station or Destroy an old One, see the Reaction of the NPC´s and how the flow of the Game changes during your Sessions. X-Rebirth is now at at Point where I can honestly say that this Feeling of hunting down the latest Offer, finding Gems in Places I dint´t think to look for, listening to the very seductive Soundtrack and getting emmersed in the Space Graphics and loving every Second of it, has become very addictive. Since I don´t know what lurks around the next Corner it has become a totally new Gaming Experience and the programming Bugs the crappy UI, I don´t care, I like it !! 												Okay; i'll be the odd one out here, and recommend this game.Why? Simple. I'm having fun -- Who am i? Just a gamer; but a gamer who was not tainted with expectation. I came to this title late it's cycle; i learned about it weeks before it launched. I had no pior X series experience, thus no expectation. Was i concerned with the state of the game's launch? Sure; but what game launched smoothly when devoid of beta testing for stresS? Few; even those who have testing phases often fall face first on launch. So it wasn't something i would consider a deal breaker. -- With the most recent 1.19 update the game runs smooth. I'm having fun with it -- and that is simply the bottom line "FUN" -- I'm usually a harash critic on games. The only major issue i have besides the launch is perhaps the price tag; it does in fact seem over-priced for any titles, regardless it's production value.That being said, yes i recommend it if you are like me; and have no expectations; and just want to have fun in an open world sand box space sim.However; i would recommend trying to pick it up on sale, or when the price drops.

												This is the first X game where i have not felt overwhelmed by so much information that the learning curve has been steep.In typical x fastion your given a large universe to make your own do everything from making your living thrugh trade and mining to being a bounty hunter or commanding a huge battle fleet.The game still retains the depth it has always had while lowing the learning curve so new players can easily get to grips with how the game works and then expand on that in thier way.you can now board space stations and interact with NPC`s recruiting crew for your stations and ships but there are some short falls here, indoors do not look as good as the amazing sectors you fly thru and there are only a few layouts to these stations and they are offten repeated and while any x player will tell you this is only a small part of the game and you will spend most of it flying your skunk it still does feel like it was a last minute attachment.Right now the game is being rapidly patched due to some preformance and AI issues but a developer from Egosoft has been updating people repeatedly on the steam forums and with time the game should be relativly bug free (the same problems did occur with X3 terran conflict).the game is worth playing but it might be worth waiting a few months untill some more patches have been thrown at it but to me this is one of the best X games there is and is worth your time.

content:
, 2016
												31 Hours of disappointment.I just tried this again. I originally got it on pre-order and was one the many who felt badly burned by it.I have been a major fan of X since the first game. On X3TC (the best to date I think) I have my own sector with a complex hub and a small army. At the time this came out the game ran badly and my PC was not as good as it is now.So I've got it all running like a dream. It still wont work well with my HOTAS system and using a controller makes the game feel awful. So I load a save (after some taffing with controllers) I'm trying to get to grips with the controls and a massive ship just starts shooting me for no reason and blows me up.I'm all like WTF? I reload my game and fly over to a station away from the crazy killer ship. I start to scan the station thinking this isn't so bad, just then the massive ship blows up in the distance. I'm all like WTF? After some random button mashing I manage to find the sector map to have a look... But... They have ruined the maps obv and I cant move around it or zoom or work out how to interact with the damn thing, so I back just out of it confused and annoyed.I think  I should land and do some trading so I fly over to the station and fly thu the bar icon but nothing happens. I am sitting there trying to work out why it's not bringing up the menu for dock and police surround me and say I need to drop my illegal cargo. I'm like WFT?! So after a few minutes of trying to find out what cargo I'm holding I work out that I have nothing in my cargo bay. So... I just fly away thinking wtf is that why I cant dock?! After a while of menus and messing I work out that I'm locked onto a ship (must have happened by accident while I was trying to navigate the sector map). After a few more minutes of taffing I find that there is in fact no control for deselect or clear target. I try the keyboard commands for "next target" and "next object" but nothing. I'm like WFT?! I stare at the bar for a moment then just start pounding all the keyboard buttons in desperation, then hit alt tab and end task and uninstall it (again).In short playing this game is like trying to play Mozart by rolling legless around on the floor and clapping with hideously deformed stumps where your hands should be.I advise anyone interested in this game to buy “X3 Terran Conflict” instead it may not look great but it is a Mozart to this Pollock's!Actual Review:Graphics: 7/10 - Looks nice maybe they should make screen savers or something?Audio: 5/10 - Annoying bad voice acting ahoy!! Massive ships purr like kittens?!Gameplay: 3/10 - Confusing, broken, ruinous, boring & stupid. Bad controls, bad combat, bad trading, bad maps, no scavenging, bad single ship idea, super computers can fly ships but you still need to hire a full crew to fly your trade ship?! Tiny universe filled with bad ai you don't even want to interact with.Ease of use: 2/10 - Even with a controller it's confusing!Overall: 3/10 - Extra points removed for killing another great franchise in the name of casual gamer cash.

28, 2015
												NOT THE GAME FOR BUSY WORKING ADULTS WORKING 12  to 18 hour days that just want a quick game to play  for up to an hour. My suggestion is that  they please add an auto save feature. Just bought the game to try it out after reading how many fixes  were done to it as the initial problems had kept me from buying the game. Accidently fired weapons to friendly station and was demolished promptly after. Got a message saying game over. Had to start the game from the beginning because my right mouse button and my left control button BOTH act as one and fire weapons because you guys set by default redundant buttons all over the place that do the same thing. Too many buttons all do the same thing:So one button I hit on accident and it caused me to lose all of my work in the game forcing me to begin from the begining. Please add a function that after meeting each objective for missions, it will save it automatically. Most games have that feature. I remember old console games that didn't have that when I was a little kid but I hardly ever run into that issue anymore  with games today. I didn't know I had to save it myself non-stop. Lose camera gives headache: Ship won't respond properly and spins all over the place or gets stuck in graphics:Also please do something about the constant camera wobble. Makes it hard to fly or get anything done when every thing is flipping around non-stop and doesn't run smooth and steady while in flight. Feels clunkly and the camera feels way too lose. Seems like when I push on the up arrow key the ship refuses to go up, instead it just heads straight down. Probably a key binding thing I will have to invert because it's annoying to have the ship do the opposite of what I ask it to do. I also wish that your tutorial wouldn't allow the player to continue until they meet the requirement of the tutorial. This way it stays on the screen longer while a new player is adjusting to the controls. You offer tips at the beginning but then they vanish in a blink of an eye leaving me to wander around the controls menu again to figure out what I was supposed to be doing. Add a map that opens with M on keyboard which is standard. Docking is a nightmare:Wish there  was an option from far away that you can click and set corse/ dock to avoid loss of time and dealing with that wobbly ship. I also  find it difficult to dock because I have to get really close  to the location and then hit the icon twice just to get the dock option to pull up but the stations have a lot of junk in the way and  the ship just goes all over the place or bangs into stuff or gets stuck on a graphic. Confusing mission book:Not able  to view current mission I'm on. When  I hit enter just a bunch of junk pulls  up that makes no sense to me at all. I can't just track a mission or see current mission or set course for just current mission. I have to click on these little plus signs and I just don't get it  because when I read them it has nothing to do with what I am doing. The whole experience so far is just one confusing thing after another. I am sure once I get passed  the confusing junk in the menus and the wobble camera settings or flight controls that it will just become the fun game that's advertised to be. But for now, I'm just so confused. I have never felt so lost in a  game before. I wish a more simple version was available with less trash all over the menus. If you can get passed the trash in the menus, you just might have a good game here. I was disapointed. I was really  looking forward to a high tech  computer system or digital awesome  looking mission book with great options for flight courses and controls leading you from one mission to the next. Instead I got a blurry pixle menu with plus signs and none of those missions appeared to be the ones I was working on at the moment. It reminded me of one of those really old  man games where they show you all missions ahead of the one you are working on instead of using a lead in quest system to make it easier and friendly for people. Like old school junk. Your ship:Everytime you enter through the little door to go sit down at the controls  of your ship, it looks nasty and dated, old and clunky, nothing digital and cool looking there, no consoles you can activate to do whatever you want to do and it takes almost a minute for your character  to sit down because apperently your piloting station is inside the ship but really it's on the outside cause you start gravitating all  over the  place  like a moron. But when you land on stations you do not float at all, there is no gravity in space, only on your ship. It's just totally confusing, dated, and flat out ♥♥♥-backwards. It's like one of those old sci-fi movies from the 80's. I really expected something out of this world and truly MODERN and unique while digitally great and with simple menus. I couldn't even interact with  my console and pull up space stuff / missions. I just looked at the ugly console with  nothing there and some annoying women. YUCK! No co-op would I think it would be awesome:Would be nice to also see a co-op version so you can play this with  a handful of friends.  Too many single player games but at the same time it's nice playing with other people too. I picked up a mission to craft an egg which I  wasn't able to find in my mission log again because of all the little plus signs and junk that made no sense in the menu. However it never showed me how to craft a single thing so that mission isn't remotely possible for me to complete at the moment either because I can't GUESS WTF to do. Your destination lights up but that's lliterally it. Just so confusing from one moment to the next. I just do not have the time to dip into  this game just to guess  every little thing. It's not friendly for the busy gamer that has a busy life schedule. I kinda just wanted to jump in and start playing but I'm so lost that I don't think with my current job that I can even find out how. I can't stand the guessing games that do that. It's frustrating and way too time consuming. If you have the time and do not work, then this game might be for you. Ugly npc's too.Gathering intell on stations, tricky:They tell you to gather information on stations for discounts but when I get close to one it doesn't show me where the info is and it won't highlight where anything is at. I see martini glasses and doors and wrench icons but that's literally it. I don't want a martini, I just want to play.Remember to spam the save button non-stop. Besides  playing and having fun your number one priority and the thing  to do the most, more than playing is to save. MANUALLY. As if it's not frustrating enough, you need to manually save this old game or one mistake  in  buttons due to redundant buttons used by default will cause a mistake you will not recover from.Most my time when into saving until I have bored to death of saving and thenhad to take a break from playing it due to boredom. I recommend  this for the stay at home husband or wife with no life. Not for gamers who just want to jump in and immeadiately make stuff because they do not give you much info that's helpful. I don't like playing games where I have to spend 20 plus hours reading and researching stuff on it just to play the game. I just do not have that kind of time. Not recommended for busy people, only for bored and available people. they may have corrected a lot fo their problems but for me, it was still not worth it in the end due to the spamming of the save button and the contantly feeling lost feeling of not understanding or knowing WTF to do. If I ever get the time to make it passed the clunky junky confusing little menus and weird flight controls then I will edit this.

												With the poor reviews it recieved i was initially sceptical about buyong X Rebirth, Been a firm fan of the X series however i eventually succumbed to the question " what was so different about this new reincarnation". Playing it brought to mind an old favourite Privateer 2 with it's rent a cargo ship to trade mechanics, Privateer 2 was a brilliant game and the introduction of the space highways was similar to Freelancer- unofficial sequel to privateer 2- and supperbly done too. Most will complain about this reinvention of the X series, i see it as catching up with modern trends in the genre. The single ship implementation is actually quite a brilliant stroke as it fits in with the game story very well. The player still may own a fleet of ships to trade with, one just cant pilot them as befits an individual caught up in galaxy changing events. Saying that there are still a vast number of upgrades and hardware to fit. Just wish there was more to be done on stations. The game all ties well together, some will complain about the voice acting or animations on NPC's but they have always been a bit hamfisted in the X series. Overall i'd give this game 7 out of 10 and consider it a nice filler till star citizen and Elite Dangerous come out ;)

content:
er 25, 2013
												In time it will be Incredible! Awesome! Amazing! You need to wait a few months until then though :(I have come to my conclusions based on my experiences alone, not on what others have posted based on their opinions.Game Rating:  0/10            ( I cannot give a rating on a game that is simply put, "NOT FINISHED!" )I am an experienced Video Game Beta Tester, QA Member and I am of the opinion that this game is still in its Alpha Stage.There are too many game stoping bugs, crashes, plot breaking bugs and poor performance issues on a huge array of different spec computers (Low, Mid and High End PC's).  The developer has stated on their website that the game has NEVER been optimized for any High End PC's or SLI / Crossfire setups. Yet during their prelaunch developer videos "Bernd", the head honcho at Egosoft states to the viewers the game Scales Great across all computer specs because it was developed to do so. If you have 2 core, 3 core, 4 core or 8 core the game will use it all to the maximum it can. This is obviously not true as it contradicts his latest statement that its never been optimized for High End PC's. The AI under your control (Ships, Stations and Personnel like Captains, Engineers, Defence Officers, Managers etc.) do NOT have enough commands in their menus to complete actions properly in the game. Such as Targeting an Enemy with a HOTKEY, commanding one of your Ships to attack someone or even order ship "A" to Protect ship "B". I would wager 80% to 90% of those awesome command abilities we had in the previous X-Games are no longer in game! Those types of commands and the few commands you currently Can give do NOT work most of the time.Graphics: 8/10I love the graphics in this game! The stations, the Sectors, Nebulas and Ships all look incredible to me. I am also a HUGE fan of the cockpit in this game. Breath Taking comes to my mind as I fly around and admire the amazing job the Art Team did on this game. However, there is one down side to the graphics in the game and that would be the characters and how they are animated. They look like they were stolen from a video game created in 1998. Just bad!Trade: 0/10 (Game is to broken with bugs and missing commands to even try trading in my opinion).Fight: 7/10Great when it works (Such as the ships you own actually fighting back against who ever is attacking them!) with other ships that you own which at the moment they do NOT, unless you download mods but I have found it still to be very buggy. The other problem is that the capitol ships seem to clip through each other and stations when they are in battle. Fighting with your ship vs others though is fun and actually better in most cases then the previous X Games!THINK: 0/10 (With trade not working properly and lack of commands this is in my opinion NOT FINISHED! Still in the Alpha Stage of development)BUILD: 0/10  (With trade not working properly and lack of commands this is in my opinion NOT FINISHED! Still in the Alpha Stage of development) Not enjoyable in my opinion with out Trade working properly and having more commands available.SHOULD I GET THIS GAME?  Yes or NO    (I will leave that decision up to you. I would like to inform you that even though this game is currently not at an acceptable level for release as a finished game it will eventually be an AWESOME game! Egosoft has made a mistake in releasing the game at its current level of development BUT they will continue to support it by fixing all the bugs and adding new content/features. Over the course of the next few months the bugs will be fixed, new features will be added and the modding community will knock out some of the Best Mods out there in the gaming universe!I Purchased the game and I am glad I did! Egosoft has a fantastic reputation for Fixing Bugs found in its games and for Supporting their games for Years later with New Features and Content that was given to its playerbase for free!Cheers

												To Recommend or not to Recommend, that is the question....Why I would recommend:+Amazing scenery, if your computer can handle it, space will look absolutly amazing.+Cool cockpits to change at anypoint upon finding a mechanic.+Fun combat.+Plenty of places to go, huge world .+Free Mode, dont want to play campaign? No problem, this mode lets you decide what you want to do in the universe on your own time.+Not that this really matters, but I can't get over how awesome the main menu song is. Cant find it on YouTube anywhere :(+Get a fleet together to fight off enemies, mine, and trade.+First day launch was a huge mess. If the game was still like that I would flat out say "No" to getting this game, but they have been trying to release patches to fix the wrongs in the game which is nice. Should the day 1 release not be a buggy pill of trash? Yes, without a doubt, but I think they are stedily improving the game with every patch to be what was expected.Why I would not recommend:-Right now typing this review the standard version of the game is $49.99 U.S. dollars, and this has far to many issues to be that price, It feels more like a $24.00 dollar game at most. -It might just be me, but I struggle using the keyboard and mouse set up for this game. Xbox controller is so much easier for me and it should be the other way around.-Space looks amazing, but interiors look dull and uninteresting also the people look like that Silly Puddy stuff I played with as a kid. Absolutly horrible people textures.-I like the fact you can walk around space stations and your ship at will, but there is no easy way to find stuff (mechanics, crew members etc.) asking for directions is the only way to find the things you need quickly. I am generaly lost when it comes to finding people.-Only one ship. Thats all you got, can't buy a different ship or anything. Your stuck with it the entier game and in Free mode.-Game has Framerate issues at times. My computer specs pass the recommended requirments yet it still lags at times. I have tried completely lowering all settings to minimum, but it didn't change preformance at all.Summery:yes. I do like this game. When I look past the bugs and just explore the vast universe and sheild my eyes to the horribly textured people, the game is fun. The only reasons I would say "No" to this game is if it's not on sale. Do not pay 49.99 for it, wait till it becomes cheaper. Also if you don't really like space sim games then don't even try to get into this one. Play other good ones, dont let this ruin your first space sim impression. I would say this is a game for people who understand the genre quite well. Hope this helps your buying choice. It sure took me a while to get my self to buy it, but when it came on sale I just went for it and im pretty happy I did. Still needs imrovement non the less, but works.

I highly recommend the Support crew of this game because of ther dedicated professionalism, and excellent service & bedside manner :-)

												This has to be the first time I've ever purchased a game from Steam and truly regretted it. I went into this game very much excited, and expecting to be captivated by the vast expanses and sandbox freedom. However, what I received was just terrible.Pros:• Beautiful graphics while exploring in your ship.• A lot of freedom over crew and fleet.• The feeling you are in a sandbox universe.Cons:• High-end USB headsets do not work - PERIOD. (Enumeration issues.)• EXTREMELY limited high-end flight stick and HOTAS support.• No SLI support nor currently working SLI bits to force from other games.• Laughable sound quality everywhere, and poor texture quality "indoors".• Oh god, the soundtrack. :(((• NPC models look like they were ripped from the original Deus Ex, along with their robotic animations.• There is no flight model here, nor physics, apparently. You can be at a full throttle boost, jerk your throttle to the 0 position, and your ship will stop on a dime. Like, wtf? Is this space, or water?• Uninteractive ship UI which requires chained keybinds and a terrible command menu system to navigate.• The command menus are unintuitive and have no clear descriptors for options.• The official support forums and FAQ/Support Wiki are just a mess.• The official site is clearly web 1.0 90's style design, and unintuitive - so forget about finding help.Seriously, just wait for No Man's Sky. On its worst day, it has to be better than this. ASTEROIDS is better than this.

												Most reviews lately have been negative due to the bug-filled innitial release of this game. However, I can positively say that as of the 2.0 release, almost all of the bugs many people complained about have been fixed. Thats not to say that there are no bugs, as there are still a few, but the majority of them that damaged gameplay have been resolved. Anyone who is a fan of previous X series games would love this game. In addition, there are many mods out there that also enhance gameplay, and make the game easier or more interesting, depending on how you use them (I.E the "no fuel cells for player ships" mod and others).To those who have the game, i've noticed that many people complain on the difficulty of completing the main story line station construction mission, due to the fact that the only stations that sell most of the materials needed for station construction at that poin of the story line are hostile towards you. I found enjoyment in this fact, as I spent lots of time hunting down ships carrying the needed resources, and had to spend time creating plans in order to raid the enemy ships, bring in ships to collect the resources, and safely transport them back to my station construction area. To those who dont want to spend time finding the resources, or want to simply create their own empire with numerous stations and ships, you can easily modify your save game files using notepad ++ or other XML editing software, however notepad ++ is much easier to use. Any information in regards to modifying the game files, simply look online, there are many topics about it, especially since the initial release of the game occasionally needed this to work (but as I said these problems have been solved since the 1.25-2.0 release).To those who wish to get into the X seriese games, or are new to them, my recomendation is that you start with the previous ones, like X3 terran conflict or albion prelude, before starting X rebirth in order to understand some of the backstory that (at least to me) is very interesting. For those who have experience with the X series games, I recomend this game 110%. But people must realize that while it is an X seriese game, it is not an expansion of X3. It is its own stand alone game that expands the story of the x universe. People trying to compare it to its predecessors does not give this game justice, as it has many fetures that i found were missing in previous x games, that makes this game feel more lively. not to mention the universe itself is absolutely gorgeous and stunning graphic-wise. My recomendation to those having trouble with the game, mess around with the controls and commands, and you will see how simple some things are that once upon a time seemed difficult and unable to work. I hope this has helped all those thinking of buying this game, and all those who had it, but chose not to play it due to previous bugs and problems that might have been fixed since the latest patch. All this being said, i look forward to egosofts next update, and hope they expand the main storyline with new stories, missions, AND THE ♥♥♥♥ING BORON!!!! I MISS MY SQUID ALIEN FISH THINGIES! I WANT THE BORON TO COME INTO THE GAME LIKE GENGHIS KHAN AND SAY YOLO TO THEIR PEACEFUL WAYS DAMNIT! :D happy xenon hunting everyone:)

ry 25, 2016
												This game is terrible. There's not a single redeeming factor to this game. Not even the DLC fixes this giant mess.I paid no heed to the reviews because, from what I had seen, it was hardcore fans of the series complaining about how it was different to previous games. I thought the game itself might actually be good and all the negativity was simply disgruntled fans but holy crap was this an absolute waste of money.-This game was released in 2013 yet the character models and the textures in general look like they're from 2005 even maxed out.-Performance is terrible. 80-90FPS on a high end rig in some areas but 40-45FPS in other areas with not much being rendered on screen. Terrible.-There is no lip sync. Period.-Voice acting is terrible.-The first character you meet places her hands through the freakin' keyboard constantly and very visibly. Unacceptable in this day and age(Or even 2013) especially at the price the title is selling for.-You can only explore a very, very small area at a time in first person view and each area, so far, looks like utter ♥♥♥♥♥.-The highway system is ONE WAY and it's also the only way to travel from system to system. You miss your exit? You've got to do the round trip and try get it on your second loop.-You have no warnings or any feedback to speak of when exiting the highway which often results in you leaving the highway when you were simply trying to dodge traffic(Why is there even traffic in the damn thing?!).-The controls are terrible. They're unintuitive, they feel clunky and the UI/sidebar is a poor man's EVE Online sidebar with zero reason to use it other than the fact that the options you need are there(Yet they could have easily been hotkeys or a button you click while in cursor mode).-Cursor mode: It sucks. If you use autopilot you can't exit out of cursor mode.Everything about this game sucks. Everything that they implemented is so very poorly done. Some options or functions are there for the sake of being there. There's added UI overlays for the sake of adding them despite the fact an amature developer could see how confusing and annoying half of this stuff is when you could easily have just used a hotkey or had a visual button you could press when using your mouse to move around. The side bar shouldn't be in this game, it just adds "clunk" to these already clunky controls.It left such a sour taste in my mouth after the hour I played I just can't be bothered writing proper paragraphs to fully detail what's wrong here and why it's not worth the money. I'm just so utterly annoyed at how terrible this product is. If there were one thing I wish I had read about this game and highlighted it would be "This game looks and feels incredibly cheap." It's a cheap budget title selling for €40, even at 9.99 it ain't worth it.Do not buy this game.Ever.

												dear oh dear where to start?the performance is absolutely atrocious, i have a fairly decent rig (6core 3.8ghz cpu, gtx660Ti 16Gb ram) and I have never seen this game get above 40fps in empty space with nothing around you.if you throw a ship or station or some combat into that mix expect to see frame rates of 15-25fps.on the stations (if you can call them that) it is even worse (I've seen 5fps).the graphics are dated, the NPC's models are beyond horrible (even if this game was released 5 years ago you would still say the station graphics were dated) the voice "acting" is abysmal, with the same few lines of dialogue re-used over and over and over. (if you thought arrow to the knee was bad you have not heard anything yet).the Ui is awful, and it is a chore to navigate.there are a lot of game breaking bugs that when they rear their ugly head you simply cannot progress in the game.I have only played 7 hours of this so called game because it is just such a chore to "play"there is no joystick support (it supports a 360 controller and thats it) if you have a flightstick forget using it with rebirth.I have a saitek x52 pro (the perfect controller for a game like this, which works perfectly with previous X games) you simply cannot map the buttons to anything in this game. your throttle won't work, 90% of your buttons won't work, your HAT switches won't work. you are restricted to 8 buttons and 1 hat switch (a 360 controller with its dpad)do yourself a favour.buy X3 Terran conflict or Albion prelude.and install the Xtended mod. if you do that you will have a game that is 100% better than X rebirthterran conflict is £15.99 and albion prelude is £9.99 so you could have both of these great games for less than the price of rebirth, and you will get a game that you can at least play and enjoy.

												First of all things to consider is : are you a X3 or X2 or even X veteran ? If not, you can enjoy the game as it is right now (consider though there are still bugs, some of them are game breaking. Egosoft is working on them, so yeah, bugged, but not unfixable).If you are a X veteran, then this is more difficult to tell. I'm an X veteran, and I'm hugely disappointed with this X Rebirth. I guess I was expecting X4 (don't shout about "they told it it wasn't x4"). I was expecting X4. I was expecting a new way to play, with a rich universe, filled with all the possibilities I had in X3AP or TC. It's not there at all.Here are though some of my thoughts about the game : - The graphics are beautiful (in space, in station I find them ugly, but once again, this is solely my opinion).- The universe is big, but I don't feel like I'm in space (understand space, where there are a few station and lots of empty space). Stations are huge, I like that idea, but it feels like big cities now.- The highways are a new neat way to move. It's a shame they block your view with a minigame (you drift behind vehicles to go faster. I would have prefered the neat view with no vehicles in front of me).- They promised "every ship in the game has a reason to exist. It does its thing". While I can't argue this might be true for most of the big ships, I must say this isn't true at all for the ships that spawns in the highways, making it impossible to spy on other ships, see their venues and find what their routes are.- There is only 1 playable ship (understand in which you can jump). You can control other ships, but it's really limited (against what X3 offered us).- There are only 4 weapons for your ship.- Only 4 regions, which are not truly dedicated to a faction. In X3, sectors were belonging to a faction. Here, the factions are mixed everywhere, making the game for the factions disappear.- This Rebirth is more dedicated towards fighting. Of course you can mine, you can (try) making the economic play (very difficult, there is no real economy, it's more places where you can buy and sell more than a logical economy balanced by the player), or kill the pirates. But this game is more action packed then the X3AP was.- Even if the idea of walking in station is nice, going inside stations and searching for the right guy is kinda weird for an x veteran. I need to ask the other ships in the game where I can find this man, rather than having a nice list of what you scanned as in X3.These are in very short some things I think and feel about X Rebirth. I loved the game at start, and then when I saw there were no such possibilities as in X3, I felt I had the wrong game bought. But once again, this is my opinion on it.I don't want to say this game is bad. A friend of mine is playing it, he never went in the X Universe, and he loves it. He hardly understand why I don't like it. So will you like this game ? I don't know. Read, and watch some gameplay about it on twitch, or youtube, make you see the game, and decide for yourself.

												Where do I begin? This game has not lived up to my expectations as an entrant into the X Universe. First off, on release day the game was so chocked full of bugs that I found it largely unplayable. Oh, the basic flight controls and interactions worked (mostly), but you couldn't stop a trade order given to a ship without going into the save file and doing some xml editing to clear out the "stuck" command. The main interface menu in the cockpit would randomly stop working, requiring either saving and then reloading to clear it, or jumping back&forth between the back of the ship and cockpit. Neither were 100% certain to clear that particular issue at any given time.As for much of the other problems, they seriously dumbed down many of the foundational aspects of the X Universe. Remember the encyclopedia? That handy little in-game list of pretty much everything you've seen? That included things like where a certain ware was found to be sold? Gone. Oh, not all of it. It's still there, but the only things you see are the ware type, volume per unit, container type, and a brief "flavor" blurb to read/listen to the computer spew at you. Remember the map system that allowed you to pan around the map, select targets from the list for interaction, etc? Gone. Replaced with a very inflexible top-down-only view, no pan/zoom, and very limited list-based interaction. Remember targeting controls? Also gone. Replaced with a single mouse-click type/center reticle selection. Oh, the game also likes to forget your target randomly. Remember being able to tell your owned ships what to do? Yup, also severly stripped down. Remember trade goods/wares that NPC stations actually needed? Yeah, half of the classic ware list is "junk loot" now, to be sold to in-station NPCs, carried aboard your own ship, with a seemingly infinite cargo space.Speaking of NPCs and the game's "Artificial Life." It's on life-support. Most of the ships you'll ever see on screen, just fly aimlessly in circles around huge stations. Most never even display a target icon unless you target them specifically. Only a few will, and those are the only "real" npc ships you'll see, aside from the cap ships.Remember building massive, multi-station complexes wherever you pleased? Yup, gone. Replaced with location-based build sites. Remember building up a squadron of fighters? Last I had played, only the cap-ship merchants worked. Oh, there were docking platforms for "civilian ships," complete with icon, but no ship-builder NPC. That was as of 1.14, by the way.I could really go on, but I think by now you get the idea. In the end, I really wish I hadn't spent my money on this game. I had pre-ordered. And while doubtful I'll ever see it, I am indeed asking for my money back, or a refund. Save yourself the headache, and just pass this game over.

												A dissapointing mess of a game. Bugs and performances issues aside (they can be patched out), there are design choices that hurt this game on a fundamental level. Walking around on space stations and talking to NPCs may sound like fun on paper, but in practice it's tedious and ultimately pointless. The interface is cumbersome, apparently designed for Gamepads, making it much harder to get anything done than in previous X titles. The new sector/system maps are so clumsy as to be practically useless. The characters are all poorly designed and badly animated, and the dialogue and voice acting is embarassingly bad.The inability to fly anything other than the starter ship, or create a player character other than the one named, human male the game throws at you, means that there's no possibility of pursuing your space-faring fantasy. No Han Solo or Malcom Reynolds for you, you are who the game says you are.Despite some improvements in terms of visuals and the ability to move about faster (via highways and a faster boost), this game is a huge step backwards for the series and not worth paying full price for.

												Be careful when buying this game. It can look pretty in the screenshots, but do a quick internet search. This game instantly became infamous as a broken mess plagued with game ending bugs. My campaign (and many others) was stuck 2 hours in as a result of the capital ship unable to dock. I've read they've since released a couple of patches that may have fixed this specific issue and a few others. However, aside from the game breaking bugs, the interface and gameplay is rather tedious and not at all like previous X-games. Although I like the colorful space objects around me, it's hard to see out of my cockpit that has no option to rotate your view. Your annoying co-pilot spits out three different lines of dialogue every 3 minutes. It was a poorly kept secret this game was originally planned as a console release, and menu options are hard to read, hard to click buttons. Its reminiscent of the Mass Effect raidal menus, yet requiring the player to actually click the button rather than mouse gestures selecting an option.Speaking of Mass Effect, X Rebirth thought it was a good idea to add a 'mini-game' of collecting useless 'vendor trash' by running around stations clicking boxes and crates. In my gametime, I found only two different station interiors, and graphics quality reminded me of a Playstation One title. Running around in these sterile, depressing stations is required to hire crew members, trade vendor trash, and some complete some missions. Unlike the robust economy in previous X games, trading is done via manual trade orders given to your capital ship. To add to this, you can't give orders remotely, but rather fly to different stations to issue a buy order then fly to a different station to issue a sell order. I don't think you can even set that particular order to repeat.

 DEVELOPER STICKS WITH BROKEN GAME, MAKES IT FUN!  Make no mistake dear reader, the learning curve for this game is a brick wall.  However, my hat is off to EgoSoft for taking the time to fix most of the glaring issues over the last four years.  That is why I have removed my negative review and am writing this one to take its place.One Ship to rule them allEgosoft bet the farm on the single player ship. While the ship itself feels like a real lived-in sci-fi location, your co-pilot sucks the atmosphere right out of the cockpit with her two dimensional personality.  The other issue is modding the one ship.  There are many different loadout options, but the differences felt largly superficial to me.A Man and his SkunkThe story is of a man quickly drawn into a conflict due to the people that he associates with.I will hide campaign details, but the spoilers are minor.  Be aware that you will be at war with the most powerful known faction in your game!  I found myself enjoying the story as we fought our guerilla war agaisnt overwhelming odds.  However, I was baffled as the campaign started to wind down that I had not really made much progress with the main goal.  The ending seemed less like a satisfying conclusion to that paticular story and more like a whirldwind tour of the X universe major players.  (with a few races left out) Not so Free CommerceThe lack of a free trade mode for your freighters is dissapointing, but understandable.  Once you have a Trade Agent on all the stations, making money with manual trades becomes fairly easy.  I got to the point where anytime I found a new station, I placed a Trade Agent...it made my life a lot easier.  Funds can be acquired in an automatic fashion by setting up stations wisely.  EgoSoft gave us a basically virgin sector that makes a pretty good base of operations.This game has quirky systems, you have to learn them on it's terms.  Based on all the work that EgoSoft put in since launch, it is worth trying out.  I have the DLC on my wishlist and plan on picking them up! (just as soon as they go on sale)

												Re-reviewing this game after 3.0 and Teladi Outpost DLC. I stopped playing somewhere after 2.0 because even the modded experience wasn't fun.Originally I would not have recomended this game to anyone. It was bug-ridden, making the campaign mode pretty difficult to play through. It had terrible design elements as well as missing basic elements any game of the genre should include.After the numerous patches, it's clear Egosoft took these issue into consideration, listened to feedback, and stood behind the product to continue it's development. There are clear influences of popular mods now included in the game, and the vast majority of my original complaints have been addressed one way or another. I have been enjoying the game even without any mods, something I wouldn't have thought possible based on my previous play experience.To name a few examples (far from a complete list, but I won't bore you to death with this review): You can now give basic orders to your ships, such as Hold Position and Attack this object. There is no more drafting in the space highways. GG atmosphere (or lack thereof). Transferring wares between your own ships is a separate command - it still follows some of the rules of the trade system, but you are no longer buying things from/selling things to yourself. GG concept of ownership.Difficulty - on Hard difficulty there is an actual challenge when dogfighting. The AI sometimes shows it's shortbus origins, but a lot of the time it can be hard to shake an attacker in open space while dogfighting, and the AI seems to know how to take advantage when you are an easy target by continuing to pummel you rather than firing a few bursts and flying past. It's also more difficult to board capital ships, especially military ships, and there is a system in place for your marines to advance in skill - instead of just buying elite marines at an expensive price, they work up to that point through successful boardings.There are still some issues I have with the game, but based on the progress made so far, and the fact that ES continues to work on their product, I felt I had to change my review. There is still work to be done, and I'm still not happy about the original state of the game at release. There are still elements of the game that seem too simple, and methods of control/UI that are lacking. But I think I can safely say that this game is worth a shot if you can get it on sale. I may not have liked the original release but there is something to be said about supporting developers that don't abandon their product.

												Massive Change of a Negative Review, BIG TIME!I gave up after a good go at this game, maybe I didn't add enough salt. But now, this week. Wow things have changed. This review is based on 3.61 (October 2015)The game is still fantastically buggy, still very Hardware Hungry. But in terms of content, ironing out the bumps and offering a load more. Its a very enjoyable game to play. I delved straight into the Teladi Outpost gameplay, one that I pretty much didn't bother with when I got it free on release. Recommended. You start, like all gameplay modes with a few ships but in a very hostile environment. Do your thing of fighting off all the huge bosses from blowing up all your ships in a single swipe. More importantly its huge, its every sector all in one galaxy, it takes an half hour + to visit each sector in a loop. They mean it when they say its the biggest sandbox this side of the galaxy. The game play is very very full on, you really need to think. From taking over ships with the reworked marine system (experience) to trading long term. You find a gap in the market, the economy is real and is effected by war. You stations take time, but again due to the nature of the game you can change this by picking holes in the economy or again starting some fight with a company you either don't like or can do without. After a while you see your pockets filling up. You expand your power through might and logistics, buying bigger, better ships to defend your income. This is where the Teladi Outpost DLC really got me. Its such a profitable zone that needs exploiting. All in all if you have free time (single) and enjoy a game that you need to work and develop. Sit at your PC on your day off ready with plans and ideas you want to work on this game is great!The bad bits are still quite strong in the game, for me out weighed with the shear level of economic, graphical and challenge detail this game offers so im still happy and wont shelve it. But simple things like upgrading a ship that gets stuck inside a station. Or crashes (save save save). The game is a huge hardware hog, personally im happy with this, it means the games working. Lots of ram, big CPU and an okay GPU is all you need. I have an AMD 8350 @ 4.875ghz, the game uses that at 80% most of the time. And when a lots going on, a war in another system it struggles, as in fps will drop to 30/40. Not the worst thing in the world but needs to be noted if your expecting 60fps or go playing with the graphics settings (low low low) Its still CPU intensive. If you read other reviews including metacritic, it seems everyone wants perfection. UI super simple, not ending up stuck inside a ship, no occasional crash etc etc. IMO a quicksave (like in olden days lol) is a lifesaver and common sense. Try to look over problems with (olden days) attitude. Its a huge undertaking, massive, but no other developer could have come close. The next X game is in the works, from my experiences in this game and if I was in power this game would be local networkable. Have a second computer on a gigabit network dealing with a few things while my PC deals with the other half and the game stuff (draw calls etc). But with DX12 in the works, I think this game would benefit with an API that can do much more efficient calculations  via the GPU. This game has ships not just milling about but constantly conscious (brilliant).Verdict. Its not a failed game, its a big and surprising hiccup game  form a developer everyone thought would pull it off. Try it again if you have it. Try it if you don't, its very playable, slowly improving, frustrating at times but is still a very very good game. I cant wait for the next!!!EDIT:The game is still played a lot. Its far from dead. Looking forward to seeing what 4.0 will bring.https://steamdb.info/app/2870/graphs/Old Review... (13 of 25 When I knew a new X game was coming I watched and read all I could. Pre-ordered it. Played it with a smile. Then started noticing the bugs. On and off I played it for around a year. Now 2 years on and many patches later the game feels rubbish again. I want a new new X game, but most of the features of past. Better maps as I dont like the 'in orbit' zones. More personal and commanded ships. Better stations. Im not sure if I can get into this game again, even to give the DLC a real go. The buzz has passed.

												Two years ago, I wrote that X:R was released in a very bad shape, more or less unplayable but with a faint glimpse of hope that it could evolve into something better.It took Egosoft almost two additional years after the original release to make the game actually worth playing.There remain lots of 'but', though. You are still limited to one single ship and there are not plenty of customization options. Yes, you can chose to sacrifice shield strength for a faster regeneration, but that is basically it. Both player and NPC dialogues are still terribly awkward and the voice acting is in general a huge disappointment. Worse than X3, which was not exactly known for great acting.However, the game has grown nicely in complexity. Runs without any problems even on (from today's perspective) dated machines in full details and offers some great space panoramas. The many little details you can find outside of stations or other points of interests are simply amazing (Elite Dangerous' stations pale in comparison). The station's inside, however, still suck as they did 2 years ago. Fortunately, the mechanics have changed so you will not need to actually walk inside stations very often. The plot still forces you to do this from time to time, but everything in free play can be done via remote coms.The AAA price tag is still staggering. In a world, where games on steam usually get a big discount a few months after release, this is a weird thing to do. It is even weirder because at a $10 tag, I would recommend every space fan to giove it a try. But with the current price, while still recommending the game overall, I would suggest to wait for when the game goes on sale next.6.5/10
