												Re-Review of the game as of 1.24.  Skipping introductions, you can read what I think of the game below from initial impressions to patch 1.17.  The following things have not changed:1. Trade is still hosed but does respond better.  Stations in entire sectors run dry sometimes.2. No radar/gravidar for the skunk3. Limited weapons and everything costs so much that you need to go scanning to get any money.4. No easy way to repair rep other than the missions that take you close to enemy stations.5. Performance on high end rigs like mine still sucks.6. Game is still 50 dollars when it should be 15 for an "early access" since its still a pre-beta7. NPCs are still annoying and ugly8. Starting off still sucks since you don't even start with a container ship to at least get trading.9. Skunk cannot hold cargo like a rahanas can, so at least you can get started trading.10. Crappy user interface still exists.Nothing, and I mean nothing has really been fixed without causing more problems.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------The core game in itself is a great idea.  The fact that this game was in development for seven years should have thrown a big red flag to me but I am a huge fan of sci-fi space themes.  In it's current state (1.17) the game is so unbelievably worthless it isn't even close to worth $50.00.  This is more of a fleshed out alpha that is close to beta with so many game breaking bugs it is rediculous.  The core game, where you fly around, shoot, hail, trade, and upgrade your equipment is nice.  Building your own space station is nice too.  The problem is, bugs get in the way of almost all of this. The controls for the game are wonky other than the standard space and first person controls.  Menu systems are rediculous where you have to search for what you want and even then, some basic things arn't included like transfering cargo from the Albion to one of your ships.  Why was this left out?  The "It will be there eventually isn't an acceptable answer as it should be in the game since it was considered a "full" release and not a early access.Graphics are great in space but the minute you hit the stations, it turns into a game from 2007.  Think Borderlands 1 here, that is the scale we are talking about.  Also, if you have crossfire/SLI like I do, disable it or you are gong to go from a standard 120 fps in most games to a dismal 20 or less on board the stations where nothing is going on.  Finally, all stations are cut and paste.  Nothing is unique as they are all practically the same basic 3 layouts minus a few other systems that have something different to offer.  Even those however, are cut and paste within that system.Sound is annoying, the "Shut up Betty" from Yisha gets old, the same old lines over and over is just boring.  How can a game this long in development be so limited in basic features? The space sound effects are satsifactory but I get tired of hearing the same highway music over and over.  How about some variety?Other issues such as no radar, again the "It is coming in a patch" was spout off again.  What?  Why?  The year is 29XX and there is no radar?  The map you access is fine but the on screen "No Signal" crap in the cockpit is stupid.  The only time you see a map there is when you come out of a jumpgate or highlight a gate.  The state of the economy is "We are out of everything, go get us stuff".  Don't waste your time trying to build ships, just go take them over since building them will never happen. Overall, the game could have been great and still can be.  They need to put the features advertised in the game.  Sure, trading is possible, but it is so buggy is isn't even worth the time.  Creating space stations takes forever since the only viable way to get credits is long range scanning.  So many issues and not enough game.  Refunds by Steam should not be issued since we were the ones that bought into the game before we saw the reviews and other input.  No one forced us to buy this game.  Still, I have been consumed with this game for many hours and will continue to play it if for anything, to get my money's worth.

												Re-reviewing this game after 3.0 and Teladi Outpost DLC. I stopped playing somewhere after 2.0 because even the modded experience wasn't fun.Originally I would not have recomended this game to anyone. It was bug-ridden, making the campaign mode pretty difficult to play through. It had terrible design elements as well as missing basic elements any game of the genre should include.After the numerous patches, it's clear Egosoft took these issue into consideration, listened to feedback, and stood behind the product to continue it's development. There are clear influences of popular mods now included in the game, and the vast majority of my original complaints have been addressed one way or another. I have been enjoying the game even without any mods, something I wouldn't have thought possible based on my previous play experience.To name a few examples (far from a complete list, but I won't bore you to death with this review): You can now give basic orders to your ships, such as Hold Position and Attack this object. There is no more drafting in the space highways. GG atmosphere (or lack thereof). Transferring wares between your own ships is a separate command - it still follows some of the rules of the trade system, but you are no longer buying things from/selling things to yourself. GG concept of ownership.Difficulty - on Hard difficulty there is an actual challenge when dogfighting. The AI sometimes shows it's shortbus origins, but a lot of the time it can be hard to shake an attacker in open space while dogfighting, and the AI seems to know how to take advantage when you are an easy target by continuing to pummel you rather than firing a few bursts and flying past. It's also more difficult to board capital ships, especially military ships, and there is a system in place for your marines to advance in skill - instead of just buying elite marines at an expensive price, they work up to that point through successful boardings.There are still some issues I have with the game, but based on the progress made so far, and the fact that ES continues to work on their product, I felt I had to change my review. There is still work to be done, and I'm still not happy about the original state of the game at release. There are still elements of the game that seem too simple, and methods of control/UI that are lacking. But I think I can safely say that this game is worth a shot if you can get it on sale. I may not have liked the original release but there is something to be said about supporting developers that don't abandon their product.

												[Updated for version 3.0]The outcry over the disastrous release of this game had plenty of merit, but a year of patching has seen Egosoft bring X: Rebirth from an early deathbed to a fun, engaging space game. It isn't X4. It will never be X4. Personally, I'm glad for a move toward something more game-ish and less spreadsheet-ish, but not everybody will go for this. So don't go in expecting X4, because you'll be disappointed.Most of the worst bugs seem to be gone as of the latest patch. I've put about 20 hours into version 3.0. There are some balance issues, but I haven't encountered any of the game-breakers than ruined my previous attempts to play the campaign. Trading works, and some of the previous balance problems have been dealt with. This is my experience. YMMV. Mods can still improve the vanilla game in many respects.The new Teladi Outpost content is cool, but the game still suffers from a pathetic lack of diversity in interior environments and NPC heads. The same few character models are recycled over and over and over. This is mostly tolerable, but really needs to be addressed. We've got humans and teladi, so here's hoping for future content to reintroduce the boron and paranid.Worth full price? Dunno, but it's worth playing after a year's worth of patches. It's actually pretty damn good now, as long as you aren't looking for X4.

												I have spent 239 hours on this game.  It has alot of potential.  That being said the game is still severly bugged.  I thought I was buying a finnished game.  Unless you like beta testing games I can not recomend this game until they get the bugs fixed.  Jan 2014Update Jan 2015.I quit playing the game for a while and have now returned. This game isn’t entirely what I want it to be but I am not sure that is possible yet with current technology.    I can now say that this is the best space based sand box type game that I have yet played.  If you are looking for that type of game I can definitely recommend it.  Some of the previous x games were better in some ways but they are now so dated that they are hard to get into.  The thing I miss the most from the older X games is the ability to assign a ship buy or sell a single ware for the best price from the station it is assigned.  The station managements trade AI just is not good enough to make up for that loss of control.  Some of the steam mod extensions are good and make the game that much better.  These mods will get even better when and if Egosoft releases tools for modders to design their own ship and station hulls.
